website_summaries.verdict: If you’re tired of having your WiFi stop due to issues beyond your control, the Powerline series is here to deliver your signal where you need it most.
pros: 300 meter range works for smaller spaces
Utilizes your home’s electrical system to bypass dead zone issues
Each node features an Ethernet port
Easy plug and play set up
cons: It would have been convenient if this model included an AC passthrough option so it doesn’t completely take up an outlet

customer_reviews.title: Both transmitter and receiver have to be plugged into the same AC circuit.
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept of using the house wiring to carry the WI-FI signal from one part of the house to another. The problem is both transmitter and receiver have to be plugged into the same circuit. So the transmitter is plugged into the router and an AC outlet. The receiver is plugged into an AC outlet on the other end of the house. It is very unusual for both AC outlets to be on the same circuit being that far away. I hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: BIG HELP!
customer_reviews.text: I have a pretty large house, all one level. The signal strength weakens the further you go away from the house router, so my son who is very tech savvy suggested these. He installed them and wallah, no more problems! I can now use my phone and laptop on the other side of my house. (We bought 2 because one was needed outside on the lanai). Took a bit to figure out how to install them, even with all his technical ability and experience, but once figured out they worked like a charm! These have eliminated a lot of frustration for me! Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Practical Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Solid and functional
customer_reviews.text: Well designed, they don't bloc the second side of a duplex power outlet, and they do what they say. Other than the powerline network throughput, of course - as in all these units, the throughput is about half that claimed. I incorporated these into a powerline network with a pair of TP-Link's AV2000 units, and the setup of a secure and stable network was fairly quick and straightforward using the app the company provides. Some functions, particularly Wi-Fi config, are easier and more functional using the web app, and some using the mobile one - but grab your phone and your computer based browser, and between the two you'll get it done.
customer_reviews.author: W. T. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Not working after five months
customer_reviews.text: Set this up to use my Roku in the bedroom since my wifi signal didn't reach that far. It worked as advertised, but just recently it stopped working. It would set up again and I tried all the suggested fixes. Contacted support and they offered to provide a new pair, but after about four e-mails back and forth I am getting frustrated. I'm not sure that they will provide a replacement. I think they are more interested in placing obstacles to delay sending a new unit. If I had it to do over again, I would seriously consider first setting up a mesh network from a more reliable company. I would not recommend anyone buy this product at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Glen R. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Only works if devices are plugged into the same circuit.
customer_reviews.text: The extensive online information from the manufacturer on the Amazon listing states that you can use these anywhere in your home, but the instructions included in the box tell you the 2 devices must be plugged into the same circuit. I can't use it to help in my home situation. I would never have spent the $50 had I known this in advance. All of the information online implies they can be used anywhere in your home. Not sure how all these other folks got such great results, most homes have multiple circuits. The whole point is expanding the internet capability without adding additional wiring.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: No support
customer_reviews.text: I tried to set this up, got all the green lights as they said. still can't get a signal to me TV in front of the house, the router in back of the house, tried contacting support, said server down, "press human services button" which does not exist. Very disappointed have to give them a 0 and item will be going back, on SS and have to watch my pennies, can't afford an item that does not work and where there is no support.
customer_reviews.author: Dizzy Lt

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for same circuit panel - has  to be THAT breaker switch
customer_reviews.text: Product info says this product should work anywhere you have electricity in your home, but that's NOT TRUE. It doesn't matter if it's on the same circuit panel, it needs to be wired on the same circuit for that room! So disappointed - and I did a lot of research. Misleading. I even called tech support and they said set it up in the same room so i could see the connection, then move it to the other room. I didn't know it didn't work until I had a guest in that bedroom. The wifi it shows it's picking up from the entire house - weak, drops a lot. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: erbos

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed to easily extend my WiFi
customer_reviews.text: The reason this was purchased was because my interior walls are concrete so signals wouldn't reach across my ranch style house. This extender was perfect for me since I can now get a signal on the far side using the electrical outlet. I can't compare it or review its effectiveness because it works great for me, and that's all that matters. I tried to change the name and password using the iOS app and on a PC, but ran into some difficulty. I didn't try customer service but just reset it to the default settings, which are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dad the cook

customer_reviews.title: REAL SLOW
customer_reviews.text: I just received this product, very disappointed. Before connecting the AV1000 I ran a speed test through "speedtest.net". My computer is hard wired to the internet. Download speeds average 82.60mbps / upload 92.50mbps. I then attached the AV1000 to my home gateway, the other end into a switch that my computer is connected to. (I used the Ethernet connections, not the WiFi.) The two devices are no more than 20 feet apart, on the same circuit. Download speed was 16.30mbps / upload 3.50mbps. I'll keep it, I do occasionally need a temporary connection at other places in the house and normally use a 100 foot Cat6 cable for this. I'll just remind myself it will be very slow.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jake Somers

customer_reviews.title: Couldnt get the extender to work.
customer_reviews.text: I couldnt get the actual extender to work. The powerline had a strongish signal, but the range was not enough for my home, and the extender only lasted paired for a couple of hours and then it would stop working and my peripherals were dropping the connection all day. Apparently I would need 4 or more extenders in order to get a reliable signal throughout my home, which is only one story, and aboud 2200 sqft. I searched for a solution and it required to download an app, i would get them paired and the connection would only last a couple of hours... not worth the time or money, so back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: I had great hopes for this device
customer_reviews.text: I had great hopes for this device. It is advertised as plug-pair-play. I wanted simple. But it wouldn't pair, and I called TP-Link tech support. Resetting, re-pairing, changing outlets etc did not work. To continue would have been arduous due to language difficulties... So I tried their chat and the communication was easier. But their suggestion was to download some utilities to use to update and modify the devices, and it quickly ended up being a longer process than I was willing or able to do. If it doesn't pair, it isn't plug-pair-play. I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie Katz

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: The TP-Link AV1000 was super easy to set up, for browsing the net I expected it to be faster, I have 200 mbps comcast, I dunno it still seems faster connected directly to the modem, but glad to have a wired connection in my computer room. My wi-fi was disconnecting a lot. I played a game of Borderlands 3 with my friend and there was no lag, I'll have to try more games though. I'm guessing this is 75% as fast as a wired connection would be. 4/5
customer_reviews.author: supadupakoopa

customer_reviews.title: Completely solved my outbuilding problem!
customer_reviews.text: I have a shed to which I ran AC power and made into a ham shack. Unfortunately, I did not have any network connectivity to the shack. 25 or 30 years ago, I ran a network connection to my daughter's bedroom with a network-over-power-line connection, so to make my life easier, I decided to do the same but with dramatically newer equipment using this TP-Link. It worked amazingly well and I am writing this review from the ham shack. Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Captain Electron

customer_reviews.title: Still don't understand how it works
customer_reviews.text: This actually works really well. I still don't understand how the signal travel on the electric wire, but this works way better than the wireless extender I tried. Easy to set up. I gave it the same name and password as the main network so you don't have any idea when you are using the extended wifi point or the main one. I just have a good signal everywhere now.
customer_reviews.author: Matt from Philly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my application!
customer_reviews.text: Going out into my shop (one car detached garage) I was on the outskirts of the home WiFi. My phone was in a constant battle between weak cell service or weak WiFi signal. Purchased and installed this, streaming audio this thing is great! Quick speeds on everything I've check on the phone thus far, plan to attempt some video on the iPad/laptop soon. Honestly I don't have a single complaint about this so far. Note: the "plug and play" was not quite so for me. On the quick start guide, they have some simple troubleshooting steps. Those worked perfectly. Just stay in the same room to pair right away
customer_reviews.author: F250

customer_reviews.title: It JUST WORKS!  Plug it in, and you’re done!
customer_reviews.text: It just works! Plug it in to the wall, plug the Ethernet cord into your router and press the link button. Plug the other one into the room where you want wired internet. Press the link button on it. It works. No configuring, no messing with your internet service. Secure. Fast. Easy. My son has an XBox One, and he was experiencing connection issues wirelessly. But my router is in my living room and his XBox was in his bedroom. BAM! I bought this, plugged it in, pressed the button, and it worked!!!! It couldn’t have been easier.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Steinbacher

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks!!!
customer_reviews.text: After trying 2 WiFI extenders - both didn't deliver reliable results, stumbled upon on this device one day on Amazon...bought it, arrived one day later, followed the instructions and had it working within 5 minutes. It delivers about 90% of the speed of my router. Connect both devices on the same electric phase is the key!!! If you don't know what electric phase is, google it. Basically you need to plug the 2 devices (call it the sender and the receiver) on the 2 electric circuits that connects to the same hot metal plate/bar inside your circuit breaker box. Extension cord is ok, as long is it is not a surge protector.
customer_reviews.author: WatchLover

customer_reviews.title: Does it work? Yes. At the advertised speeds? No.
customer_reviews.text: I have google fiber. That's 1gb up/down. This thing promised speeds up to 1000 mbps. The absolute best I got from this connection was 14 mbps down and 10 up. My crappy google wifi modem google includes with the service can hit speeds of 260 mbps. I was really hoping for better and a more stable connection. This was plugged into the wall adjacent to the modem. Do not get your hopes up. This will not give you ethernet speeds. At best it might work better through a brick wall. While it did work, it did not do what was promised and I am returning it. Sadly, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Ok way to extend network.
customer_reviews.text: Pairing the adapters is pretty easy. I did it with both adapters plugged into the same surge protector. I believe mine are also working across a surge projector now that they're installed. No guarantee that this will be your case as the directions say to avoid using surge protectors with them since the surge protector may filter out the frequency they communicate over. My main/only gripe with these is that my Wi-Fi devices will still favor my access point further away with a weaker signal over these, even if I'm sitting right next to them, relatively.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of TP-Link products and already use their modem, router, ethernet switch and powerline adapters. Bought the AV1000 powerline with WiFi for my girlfriends condo. She has a couple walls with appliances, mirrors and other obstructions that proved too much for her existing router. We'd get constant buffering while streaming HD video over WiFi. The AV1000 has resolved all issues and has an ethernet port for a wired connection. The only thing I don't like about this unit is the ethernet port is on the top. But it's not an issue if only using WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Very Slow
customer_reviews.text: If you need an ethernet connection to anorther place in your house, the 2 units MUST be on the same circuit breaker or they will be very slow. They perform very well in the same room, if you just need a PC across the room, or maybe on an opposit wall in another room. My WiFi network is over 6 times faster with the units on different circuits in the house, so they are not useful in a room that is not on the same circuit breaker. I will say they were very easy to set up. That's why I gave them a 3 rating.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Just plug it in for super fast Internet
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and great for those parts of the house that have dead spots. Especially useful for working from home. Not WIFI but rather uses the electrical lines in your household to create a network. Meaning anywhere you have a jack you get internet with device plugged in. Simply plug one where you have the internet, and one where you want it (you get two). Plug in the network cable provided into your router and one to your computer/Xbox etc. and away you go! Super fast connection for those using the new 3.1 Docsis modems (gig speed). Don't go WIFI, go powerline!
customer_reviews.author: Alexei D. Budsan

customer_reviews.title: Doen't do what's advertised
customer_reviews.text: First tried to set up for extending wifi to my garage (all same electrical panel), no go. Decided to try putting inside the house to an upstairs room. It connected, then dropped within 5 minutes and couldn't get to reconnect. So tried returning. I apparently hit the incorrect "print" button and instead of printing out the ups label, it simply printed that weird symbol which I was then suppose to give to ups to take the package. Instead of that hassle, I decided to wait until the 14 days expired to request another return (thinking I'd print the correct label), but now I'm Amazon says my return is "no longer available." Frustrating. Bottom line, product doesn't do what's listed.
customer_reviews.author: Lee G

customer_reviews.title: Wow what  miracle and in 3 MInutes Time!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: As a 75 year lady who doesn't know anything about connecting electronic equipment I proudly did it by myself in under 5 minutes time...and it is working like a miracle. the cable company wanted over 200 a month to do what this simple, easy, miraculous device is doing...I would highly recommend it to anyone who can't get wi fi in the other parts of their home except where the router is located. Thank you...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Setup with good WiFi Range
customer_reviews.text: I put this in the basement where there was no WiFi. It was nice to not have to run extra network cable from the second floor to the basement. It works good but was not as plug and play as advertised. It creates a second WiFi network. To make the WiFi in my house more seamless I had to download the app and reconfigure it to broadcast the same SSID and use the same password. If I had just known to do that setup would have been quicker. I would definitely recommend however and setup again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best solution for weak in-home wifi coverage
customer_reviews.text: My internet supplier apparently saved money on the modem/router. Or it seems wifi signals are inherently fragile and you will have coverage issues unless you live in a one-room apartment or a small paper house. The Powerline tech uses your domestic electricity wiring to transmit the signal, like a long octopus-like ethernet cable. And it fixes the issue. Ping is not great so can't comment on wifi gaming. My X Box uses a cable connected Powerline, which runs fine.
customer_reviews.author: John Neary Anker

customer_reviews.title: Works great with older version!
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased the older (slower) version last year and then bought this one. Hooked up these to the router and my home office in the other corner of the house and saw a dramatic increase in my internet speed. Connected the older unit to my DVD setup downstairs (for my Netflix) and they paired as if they were made for each other. I'm not that much of a techie, I like things to work out of the box. So unsure if I have this working on all cylinders, so its a 4 star instead of a 5 due to instructions on making it work at peak performance were not clear..
customer_reviews.author: The Vegas Tourist

customer_reviews.title: crappy tech that is useless vs ai mesh node
customer_reviews.text: Used this to connect from my 2nd floor office to my formal dining room that we use as a group conference area. Currently using asus ai mesh. Connected this to the router for an extended power for ethernet with multiple hubports. It did 20mbps.... regular ai mesh wifi without the power over ethernet was 140mbps...
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cayton

customer_reviews.title: Instructions say both ends have to be on the same circuit, this should be highlighted.
customer_reviews.text: Should have read that it has to be on the same circuit to work. I needed this for a remote building but unfortunately it's not on the same circuit where my router is, so I couldn't use this. Next step is to rent a trencher and bury some ethernet cable that they build for that purpose. Did work when I tested it in the same room, but really I don't need to extend my wifi from one wall to another.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but I paid for a new product and received a returned used unit
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I get the same signal remotely as I do at the original router. So why 3 stars instead of 5? Because the seller sent me a used or returned unit and not a brand new one. It arrived with someone else’s network saved on it. I had to reset the unit to factory settings to get it to work. When you pay for a new unit and receive a used unit, this is disturbing. Again, the product itself is excellent. My issue is with the seller sending a returned unit.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo Caramuta

customer_reviews.title: Really helpful device, although not as fast as advertised, no app to manage
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very nifty device, simple to install and use, 5 stars. Not as fast as advertised: I have four connected to the same circuit in an apartment built in 2008, so it is a good infrastructure. They work fine but 20% slower than advertised. TP-Link has an app for MacOS and the same in web. As far as I could find they only work for those devices that use Wi-Fi, which is not my case, so I can’t manage them
customer_reviews.author: Shibui

customer_reviews.title: only Works on one circuit, not whole house
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this product but it only works if all of the extenders are on the same circuit. The product says it’s good for the whole home, that is true if you plug them in in the same circuit. Needless to say, at my home, we have 20+ circuits so unless the extender is in the same room as the adapter, it does not work. Tech support recommended I call an electrician to discover all my circuit routes. Not really the guidance I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Worked Surprisingly well
customer_reviews.text: Worked extremely well, plug and play. With all the Recent changes in the workforce, my wife has to work from home now. Our Ethernet connection and router are located in our upstairs bedroom. Using this Powerline has allowed her to use her work desktop PC in the downstairs dining room via a wired connection. Setup and pair the two devices in the same room initially, then you can move remote extender to your desired location. The two outlets being used are on different sides of electrical panel and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Wireless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for 2 purposes. The Ethernet over my powerlines. Seemed to work ok for that. Easy to configure and got about 200M. But was also struggling with wifi in a large house. Wanted to use this as an Ethernet extender. I tried using same SSID with no improvement. Changed the SSID to a unique one. Was trying to connect to a device about 50 feet away and had "weak" signal with packet loss. No better than wifi unit at other end of house.
customer_reviews.author: cseken

customer_reviews.title: Speed is horrible
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage. It was easy to install but it cuts you network speed, if you can connect, by 3/4 the speed of your wireless router. I have a 3000 sq ft house, single store, shaped in a rectangular. The ISP router is on one side of the home and I thought I could use this to fill the void on the opposite side of the home. Nope, if you can connect at all, the speed is so horriblely slow you can’t do anything on the web. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: daniel anderson

customer_reviews.title: Pick a different brand. TP Link will be a money suck.
customer_reviews.text: Cool starter kit. Why are no additional units available for purchase? Why do I have to pay another $90 and throw half of the next kit in a drawer. Pick a brand that gives a damn, stay away from TP Link.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall an improvement from wifi
customer_reviews.text: it does work and better than wifi, I find signal cuts out sometimes and computer does not switch to wifi so I have to wait for it to come back online. sometimes have to restart computer for signal to return, unsure if product or computer. when working much better than wifi and gaming improved. I have a desktop and laptop to same device for gaming without problem. signal travels about 70 feet through breaker box to my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus J. Barrows

customer_reviews.title: Finally have good wifi throughout the house.
customer_reviews.text: I was only getting a mediocre 8mbps in my "man cave" which is in the opposite end of the house from the router and the signal kept dropping. After putting this in, which was super easy to set up, I'm now getting around 40mbps wifi and around 60mbps wired. I was hesitant that this would work since I have two 200A power panels for the house and the plugs I'm using are split between the two but I haven't noticed any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: It just works
customer_reviews.text: Load the TpPlc app on your phone or computer, plug in both adapters, the app finds them instantly. So easy to set up and manage. So far it's been rock solid for about a month. Keep in mind as with any WiFi extender, your actual speed will be cut in half of your service speed due to the way these devices have to communicate in both directions, but still plenty fast enough for my needs. I love the flexibility this particular device as you can use up three of the provided Ethernet ports or use the WiFi that is also provided. Fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Jayman10

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good! Great powerline signal for our "smart tv"!
customer_reviews.text: We've cut the cord and are now dependent on our internet connection for TV viewing. We use one of the major streaming services but were dismayed to find that our TV had to "buffer" occasionally when the wifi signal couldn't keep up. Installed this powerline kit and plugged the receiver into the ethernet port on the TV.... Voila! no more buffering, all the streaming shows play uninterrupted, and it's just like using cable again. If you're having buffering problems with streaming video on a device using wifi, this product will cure that problem!
customer_reviews.author: clyde714

customer_reviews.title: Works only if you have a simple electrical layout in your home
customer_reviews.text: Our home has two panels of breakers. My home office is on the other panel from the room where the router is housed. Some signal did make it across to the home office but it was slower than the wifi I was trying to replace. If you have one breaker used for the router and where you actually need the Internet, you will be really happy with this product. If you are in a big house with two panels, good luck.
customer_reviews.author: SWP

customer_reviews.title: Strong signal
customer_reviews.text: Excellent wireless wi-fi extender. Formerly had the cable version (not wireless) which was cumbersome and iffy. This works much better in our Florida concrete framed house (one-story, but 2800 square feet). Attached to Xfinity router/modem which still gives good coverage in most parts of house. It's my office which is a bear: piles of books and other stuff, and at other end of house from router. The TP-Link really makes a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Morrow

customer_reviews.title: So Easy!! Even for non tech person
customer_reviews.text: This came fast and it was soooo easy to install, even for a non-tech person like me. I was nervous that I wouldn’t know how to connect this myself once it arrived. But to my amazement, literally just plug both into wall outlets (not electric strips) and THAT’S IT!! They both automatically paired to each other! Now my son uses this for gaming from his room and our router is in our living room.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Benavides

customer_reviews.title: Solve your wireless coverage problems
customer_reviews.text: Unit works better than I expected it would. No interference from any electrical devices so far. Solved a big WI-fi access problem for me in the upper rooms of my home. The fact that it also gave me another LAN Ethernet port upstairs was an added plus. Enabled me to create a guest Wi-fi and a private Wi-fi for work at home. Instructions could use some additional editing for clarity but there was so much information on the web about the units that the install guides didn't pose an issue. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: GerryFM

customer_reviews.title: Terrible DHCP Bug -- Server starts in some conditions, no way to disable
customer_reviews.text: Shortly after buying this product I started noticing occasional network interruptions. Long story short, this item will start its own DHCP server under certain conditions when it starts booting up. This will cause issues for any clients requesting a lease. This mainly happens after a power outage. Many confirmations and complaints about this can be found on their forums.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Disbro

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem
customer_reviews.text: This TP-Link AP1000 Powerline extender works great. I couldn't get any usable wi-fi on one of my TV's even though it was only 25 feet in a straight line from my router. I was going to buy an extender that extended the signal from the router and my friend said NOT to get that type. He said get the one that goes through your house hold wiring. It's almost like being wired to my router. It took me about 15 minutes to hook up and get going. I could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Signoretti

customer_reviews.title: eh
customer_reviews.text: I mean it works.. but I can't get more than 30mbps off the big extender and 20 on the small one. My internet is 100mbps, more than a 60% drop in speeds. But it does work. One thing I noticed that is another negative is when I linked the second extender the first ones 2.4ghz disappeared and now only offers 5ghz, So my smart devices had to be awkwardly paired to the other side of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy install. Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Setup device by following included quick start instructions. Utilized WPS to mirror existing Asus router SSID which worked flawlessly. After setup I moved the transmitter to other side of home in garage (same outlet as garage door opener), roughly 45' from router. My internet at home WiFi router is about 180/12 and on wireless in garage I get roughly 150/8. Ping is slightly less than on home router but good for most tasks. Handoff between the two units is good. Signal strength covers entire front yard which is about 70' from transmitter which steel garage door closed.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Setup Fast, Runs Fast
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Netgear AV200 where one of the adapters fried. I'd had the old one for a few years and it was just old tech so when i replaced it I went for the TP-Link that was rated at 5x faster. I have 3 computers and a printer in my office, but the only cable hook up is in my livingroom. My cable modem is there and has wi-fi, but for comparison, my 200Mb/s internet connection capped at 65Mb/s (8MB/s) when I used my wifi external wi-fi adapter. When I plugged in the TP-Link AV2000, my download jumped up to over 160Mb/s (20MB/s) - and stayed there while I downloaded 50 GB over steam.
customer_reviews.author: JDMan

customer_reviews.title: Drops out all of the time - until I unplug and plug back in
customer_reviews.text: I have returned these as they don't work well to create a seamless network, and as it is impossible to buy another extender of the exact same type (can only purchase AC300 extender separately). But this kit also seems to have a reliability issue - it drops out constantly. After unplugging and plugging back into the wall, the extender regains it's speed. If I don't reboot, then it barely works (1.5 Mbps down from 40 or 50 Mbps).
customer_reviews.author: Nachum Kanovsky

customer_reviews.title: Product Description unclear
customer_reviews.text: The description isn’t clear. There is only one unit that is a WiFi transmitter. You can’t buy additional WiFi units!!! If you want WiFi in the room with the base unit you apparently have to buy another set and throw away the base unit. Also, signal is directional horizontal to the unit.
customer_reviews.author: R. Dimmick

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Powerline network systems are underrated, and this Wi-Fi enabled system is no exception. Even in our apartment in an old building, this works brilliantly. It also works flawlessly with older tp-link powerline hardware. Highly recommended. Do make sure you have the network key set to anything other than the default! That's a security issue.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G.

customer_reviews.title: Lies of a product
customer_reviews.text: Copied one of the signals being put out and it was only the 2.4g signal. After testing the speed it put out absolutely nothing and created 3 extra WiFi signals with different names after following the instructions on “copying the SSID” of my router. Overal terrible execution, it did nothing but waste my time. Reset the product 5 times and followed the directions each time with no avail. Terrible product barely does what it says it can.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Reeder

customer_reviews.title: Amazing at my house
customer_reviews.text: In a newer house with newer wiring, this thing is terrific. It provides a consistent network connection across three floors. It pairs immediately and without issue. Of course, you lose some bandwidth in the powerline conversion (in my case, about 50% of max Mbps), but it is worth it for the consistent connection and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: HXR

customer_reviews.title: Cords were hidden in the box! Kinda hard to set up but works well now
customer_reviews.text: This was a bit difficult to set up but once we got it my internet on my desktop works so much better. Websites actually load! It’s a miracle. My router is downstairs and for whatever reason the WiFi signal in my room stinks. It was really impacting my work since I work from home most of the time. I also couldn’t watch things like Netflix or Hulu which was frustrating. I had tried purchasing a stronger router, other WiFi extenders, talking to GeekSquad, a lot of stuff. Hopefully this will continue to work and I can enjoy the internet again.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Parten

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING PS4 boost!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help with my PS4's horrible wifi connection. From my apartment bedroom to the living room, it was only getting (if lucky) 4-8mbps.. This was so easy to install, it literally only took 5 minutes. First tested my PS4 wifi - got 7mbps. Connected to the new ethernet connection - 60mbps! Definitely recommend, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Good speed over long distance
customer_reviews.text: I connected this between the center of my house and my freestanding garage, about 100 ft away. It actually worked and reliably gets about 25MBs. Much better than I thought. The local wifi works fine the garage and it is easy to change the wifi settings. Note this unit defaults to admin/admin as the user ID and password, so I recommend changing that when you set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works well when you need everything on a single power circuit line. Otherwise, you get increasing complication with every additional circuit. Great idea and application, but was not an appropriate solution for my use case. I ended up getting a direct line run through my garage to forego any data loss/slow speeds.
customer_reviews.author: WLH

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased a laptop and needed better internet in my room. My router is in my basement in a 3 floor home. Pretty old house so I was worried my wiring wouldnt be good but it does work. Simple hook up and now have my own dedicated wifi in my room. Ran a iphone speed test and im getting up to 50 mbps via wifi. Should be plenty for what Im using it for. Instructions weren’t exactly good English but I managed anyway. Includes 2 ethernet cables which was nice. Boxes are a little bulky but thats fine. Overall would recommend. Results can very from house to house so don’t expect it to be 100%. Will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Z.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We have horrible internet as it is and almost impossible to get signal in my shop. This worked perfectly. My shop went from almost no service to the same crappy service i get in the house!!! This was absolutely worth the money! Set up a bit confusing but not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Halling

customer_reviews.title: It works great 30% of the time
customer_reviews.text: i have verizon fios 100 up/down internet. My router is upstairs, my desktop downstairs. I usually get 60-70 up/down (when it work). MOST of the time i get 10-20 up/down when its about 90-100 up/down upstairs. its ridiculous! bought this in april, since june it became less and less reliable. im currently getting about 5mbps downstairs. i had to go up the upstairs with my laptop to post this review. its so frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: Very fast connection
customer_reviews.text: They didn’t work with my house as the lines from the house to the garage to the other garage didn’t allow a connection...I gave it to my friend who’s main garage is several hundred feet away...now when we sit out there and play cornhole we have interwebs...very fast connections of roughly 120 down and 110 up
customer_reviews.author: Joel R White

customer_reviews.title: FInally ... something that works
customer_reviews.text: I needed a device that would replace stringing a Cat5 cable across the house. I tried 3 mesh systems and they were all undependable and filled with grief: Orbi, Nighthawk, and a TP-Link system. Though the SSID cloning on this didn't work, a simple manual configuration and all works very well. Thanks TP-Link for making this one!!
customer_reviews.author: Fixedfocus

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Performance!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it setup, the software interface is clunky not the worse, not great. The biggest disappointment is the performance/speed. On 5.g I'm getting 67 MB down/up and our network is 1 GB! Speed is terribly disappointing, returning tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: TRi-RUNT

customer_reviews.title: Great powerline adapter
customer_reviews.text: This adaptor was easy to install and setup. The only problem is that is a little sensitive with the outlet you plug it into. If you are on the same circuit it works fantastic. If the two adapters are on different circuits it works but not at the same speed. Overall I am very pleased with this adapter. I like having dual band wifi and three ethernet ports in my remote location.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L.

customer_reviews.title: HomePlug Powerline Wi-Fi Extender Adapter
customer_reviews.text: This worked I've tryed so many things router extenders and all nothing worked til I plugged this in. We have a large 2 story house and husband would get constant buffering and disconnects. I'm upstairs on one end of the house he is downstairs on the other end. This solved our problem once and for all. Bit of a pain to first setup but we were both on the phone and got it working just had to hit the right buttons. But we are in our 70's so if we can do it anyone can.
customer_reviews.author: Granna54

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: I'm having full bars from my Netgear router and over 180 Mbps which is located far away from my laptop and this powerline sitting next to me are giving me 10-15 Mbps. Have tried merging it with my own network SSID, keeping a separate SSID, moving locations, changing channels but slow speed never improves nor the wifi coverage. The setup was a breeze and I had no issues in have it up and running in 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Spender

customer_reviews.title: 5 star product with 0 customer service
customer_reviews.text: Our Amazon fire stick does not work upstairs, so we purchased this item. The set up is simple and quick. Our fire stick works great and the speed is very impressive. I hated their customer service though. I wanted to change my password and when I went to their suggested site tplinkplc.net, it gave me some odd error. I called them three times without any help and I gave up. I guess I am used to dealing with top notch service like Apple, Anker etc and these guys are a joke. If you don't expect any help, this is for you. It simply works.
customer_reviews.author: Pallavi Grandhi

customer_reviews.title: Great way to extend your WiFi and bring a full speed Ethernet plug to any room.
customer_reviews.text: Great product to reach areas where your routers 5ghz wifi signal is weak. Also has the Ethernet plug for full speed access. The signal is strong and maintains a strong bandwidth. Remember to check that the same 120V leg is feeding both the area by the router and where you want the receiver placed. Setup was simple and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Barrette

customer_reviews.title: Solved ALL my wifi issues!
customer_reviews.text: My home is not conducive to good wifi range.......too many air ducts and steel beams. So I grabbed this powerline wifi extender kit. Now I get a FULL 75mbps of wifi bandwidth in the room where the extender is located. Also, the gigabit ethernet port is giving me 80mbps. My provider is FIOS, with a 75 mbps service. Powerline ethernet has come a long way since the early days......don't hesitate to try this product!
customer_reviews.author: TechNut

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly easy to use, perfect for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: The connection coming from the adapter is stronger than my internet connected directly through the ethernet. I game on PC and it works just fine, sometimes I have to unplug it and plug it back in if the connection is kind of bad, can’t really tell if I have a bad modem or bad internet. Generally can’t really tell if it’s actually the product malfunctioning, it probably isn’t but the connection is normally fine for me. Anyways, it’s incredibly easy to set up and use. Perfect for when you can’t connect an Ethernet directly into your setup.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Cable

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend powerline system.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these kits for my 2700 sq foot home. I have one WiFi transmitter on each level and they work perfectly. Setup is a breeze when using the app. The system uses a feature called WiFi Move, this keeps all WiFi access points synced to the same SSID and Password. My WiFi speed is 150 mbps at the farthest room from the main connection. I used to have a powerline system made by a different manufacturer and it was garbage compared to this system by TP-Link.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Impressed so far
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know what to expect, but after plugging the base into the router (in a upstairs bonus room), and the second unit into an outlet downstairs and across the house, it worked. I did not try to rename the SSID to match the existing network as it is installed at my parents house and I figured it would be easier to tell them to just unplug/replug the device in if there were any problems; and not have to go through any other setup. I just added the new SSID to the phones, tablet, and roku. Supported the roku streamming live HD video with no problem. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: mrallen

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I just got a bad one, but I have 400 Mbps download speeds, and through this I was lucky to get about 50, and after a bit it would drop down to less then 1, not sure if over heating or what was going on. I tried different outlets and my house is less then ) months old, so I know the wiring should be good. Returned it and decided to go with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Made my wifi weak!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so i bought this because it was supposed to boost my wifi since my modem is in my living room and my xbox is in my bedroom. As soon as i installed it, i did everything the instructions said. My mbps went from 40 to 7mbps... i tried to contact customer support and nothing. I gave up and i am returning this trash ASAP
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Internet over power line non functional
customer_reviews.text: The Internet over Powerline did not work in any configuration or location. Devices would pair then drop connection. Was never able to establish a known good circuit Internet --> Router-->TP Extender --> TP Adapter --> wi-fi appliance. Even with TP Extender & Adapter paired no wifi signals discovered greater than weak signal already available from router. Did not matter if Extender/Adapter were on the same circuit breaker inside house of separated house to shop. Also The TP-Link configuration software would not run on Mac/OS Catalina.
customer_reviews.author: RAV

customer_reviews.title: Good option for extending your network coverage.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: - good setup - good wired speed - strong wireless signal Con: - bulky - no extra outlet - drop on wireless speed about 10% - 30% (tested in the same room with the extender )
customer_reviews.author: White Snoopy

customer_reviews.title: Don't install if you have a subpanel
customer_reviews.text: The design and installation of these Powerline units is pretty slick. They are easy to pair and configure. They can work if your home wiring is simple and the two locations are either on the same circuit or at least on the same breaker panel. But if you have more complex wiring, such as a subpanel to go through - forget it. It connects poorly or not at all. Better to invest in a mesh network system (which I did) or get a real ethernet wiring setup done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and works
customer_reviews.text: I had no signal in my back yard and no cables running upstairs, so I got this in hopes that it could solve both my problems, and it did! I got the Ethernet port I wanted upstairs, and although the signal is much weaker in the backyard than in the upstairs bedroom, I am able to stream music and browse the internet from the backyard now. I've got 100Mbps service, and when next to the extender, we get around 70Mbps. I followed the setup in the quick installation guide, and it worked exactly as they said, and copying my ssid and password from my router was straight forward. Overall, I am very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: K Wood

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, adequate speed
customer_reviews.text: The installation was easy and the Ethernet works well, though doesn't provide the advertised throughput - but it's more than adequate. Once I found the setting to make the 5 Ghz broadcast 802.11 ac , I got reasonable wireless speed. The provided patch cables are labeled as Cat5, so they can't deliver anywhere close to the advertised speeds. I bought some Cat6 cables as a precaution and have been happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Easy install - almost magic!
customer_reviews.text: Tech Support is the best I've ever encountered - I'm a techie and 75 years old, so that's saying A LOT!!!! Incredible follow up and personal care. Never had such a great experience. Hats off to TP-Link. This is one of the main reasons I always look for their products FIRST!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Slow speeds
customer_reviews.text: After installing the device to my outlet and plugged the ethernet cord into my router which was upstairs. And then plugging it into my downstairs outlet and plugging the ethernet cord to my switch then into my computer and using it. I experienced slower than usual speeds using both the wired powerline connection and the wifi extender connection. I do not recommend this product, it could just be my wall wiring but it just does not work for me. This is my first powerline adapter so not sure if it's defective or if I should go with a different brand. But it's way slower than my regular wifi connection.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: At first my boyfriend installed it and it didn't work due to the fact he did read the instruction. PLEASE read the instructions it makes it way easier! the little tricky part was syncing it to the router so it could have the same login. Make sure you follow the instructions and leave the extender plugged in for 5 minutes after the lights are solid before moving it. Also if you decide to change the name of your network you will have to sync it again...we found out the hard way lol
customer_reviews.author: yecenia ponciano

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't support AV2 standard
customer_reviews.text: We have a new breaker panel, and I could only find one other circuit where this would work at all. The AV2 standard supports using the ground wire, but this device only has line and neutral prongs, so no support for using the ground wire. Will be returning this item, but now I don't know how to find an AV2 extender that actually does support the standard, I guess you can't believe the specs, and they don't generally show the back of the product. Also, I tried their chat line, but that was totally non-functional.
customer_reviews.author: M. B.

customer_reviews.title: The extra boost for the outbuildings
customer_reviews.text: We needed WiFi to reach our outbuildings for various ZOOM meetings. After fussing with a regular range extender, we gave up and gave this one a go. It gives good signal in the building it's plugged in to, but does need to be moved if it needs to be used in another.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Here for good time, not a long time
customer_reviews.text: This thing was good for month. Then lights out literally. Tried calling the suppliers tech service or using their website. Too time-consuming and complicated
customer_reviews.author: jasmincombs

customer_reviews.title: They work, just
customer_reviews.text: I deployed these in an older house to buy me a few weeks until I could install a proper wired network. It's fair to say that they work but not well. Speeds are low, latency is terrible and the connection is unstable at best. now this is an older house, there is no ground at most outlets so I wasn't expecting miracles but this significantly brought forward my plans to run actual cat 6 cables to act as backhaul for the wireless. Honestly I'd recommend that you get a mesh network at this point, you're likely to see higher speeds and less instablility. Still 3 stars because it somewhat worked, setup was really easy and they're not expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Des Whittall

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent speeds and not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I live in a two story home and have problems with Signal and WiFi speeds. I hooked up the device properly as instructed and I only got very small speed boost. It didn’t perform any better than a cheap Range Extender and I wasn’t able to get “wired” speeds from the Powerline device as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Great boost in signal
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this wifi booster to get a stronger signal to our outside security cameras. It did not disappoint. It did extend our signal perfectly. Easy to set up. No technical service call was needed. I chose this brand because our main wifi unit is the same. I figured that the compatibility would make everything easier.
customer_reviews.author: fittek

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing as the eletrical outlet signal degrades after a day.
customer_reviews.text: ok nevermind that if your wiring int he house is not good, the electrical signal will result in a lot of errors and thus about 30-40 mbps. but worse ... i was willing to tolerate that if it would even do that. but nope. it degrades to 1.5 mps after a day. to return it back to 30-40mbps, you need to restart the wifi unit of the pair. lame.
customer_reviews.author: Tofu Minx

customer_reviews.title: It's good enough
customer_reviews.text: The highest speed I tested is 590mbps when two adapters are not too far away, maybe less than 20 feet. Usually the powerline adapter always got impacted by many factors, such as another appliances using the same electrical circuit. I have Gigabit connection from Verizon and the max speed from router is about 940 Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Jia J Shen

customer_reviews.title: WOW This TP-Link AC750 Powerline Gigabit Wi-Fi Kit
customer_reviews.text: So I was having some issues with my Wifi in my house. And was looking to improve desperately.... Since I've bought the TP-Link AC750 Powerline Gigabit Wi-Fi Kit I'm blown away by how fast it is and how thing have changed in the online gaming aspect. It's insane I'm amazed!!!! Thank you for having this available when I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Works well and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This was an easy to install highly effective WiFi booster. It took all of 15 mins to set up. You plug in one unit and connect to via Ethernet to your modem. You then plug in the other unit with the antenna. You locate the device in your phone WiFi setting, out in the password and it’s connected. Yup that easy
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not expandable! No add-on units are sold.
customer_reviews.text: I installed the kit and it worked as advertised. I have a very large old three story home and need additional add-on units (the AC-1350 3-port piece) but TP-Link for some reason does not sell them separately even though their own support documents imply they do. I verified this by contacting their support unit three time. Their suggestion is to buy more kits which gives me one add-on unit and a second, useless AV1300 piece (only one can be used in a network). If you need expansion capability look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: S. Monn

customer_reviews.title: WORKED
customer_reviews.text: I got the Av 1000 nano version and plugged them in hit the pair button and they work...Tried them in in other outlets throughout the house and it worked all over...Fast to for me..I would buy these as an alternative for running cat cable around the house
customer_reviews.author: Len Ricupero

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: I have "billions" of connected devices. This extender coupled with my U verse gigibit service has helped me connect an area of my house which has had spotty coverage. I particularily like attaching an ethernet cord to my smart TV which now streams all of my subscriptions, Netflix, Amazon, Roku and etc. with no buffering .
customer_reviews.author: Blueline

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to setup and can use the same SSID as your main WAP
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my daughter after she complained that she couldn't get good WiFi in her bedroom (old house, WAP blocked probably by plaster walls and a big fireplace that sits between the WAP and the bedroom, not to mention several other rooms in between). It set up easily, and can even act as a repeater, using the same SSID. Very nice unit, works well with Hi-speed or inexpensive broadband connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not reach your internet provider speeds
customer_reviews.text: I live in an older home where my main modem connection is in a room far from my office. I have the Spectrum Ultra Service package which is advertised at 400Mbps down when plugged in directly to the modem. I currently use a 5G wifi extender plugged into my desktop computer and reach ~280 Mbps download speeds. With this powerline adapter I was able to reach a maximum speed of 128 Mbps. If you don't have an extender or wifi card then this product will work to get you internet HOWEVER it will not reach the advertised speeds of up to 1Gbs.
customer_reviews.author: eloso

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but you can't buy additional adapter.
customer_reviews.text: I was having a terrible time with streaming on our smart TV's. We could not watch more than one TV at a time. This device was exactly what I needed and now everything downloads in seconds rather than minutes, the picture is perfect instead of pixelated. Very happy with it. My only complaint is that while you can add additional adapters to use on other devices along the same powerline you cannot purchase them separately. You have to buy a whole other kit when all you need is another adapter. I spoke with TP-Link customer service and they confirmed they were only sold in the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda B Gueringer

customer_reviews.title: Too limiting. Not enough information.
customer_reviews.text: The requirements for installation - "must be upright" & "same circuit as adapter" are impossible to achieve. There are also no clear instructions on how to set it up. It says to use SSID, but does not say how to do this. As a result, the device is useless and a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sherick

product_meta.title: TP-Link AV1000 Powerline WiFi Extender, Powerline Adapter with Dual Band WiFi, Gigabit Port, Plug&Play, Power Saving, Ideal for Smart TV, Online Gaming (Tl-WPA7510 KIT)
product_meta.description:
Model:AV1000 with WiFi Extender

 The Powerline TL-WPA7510KIT extends your WiFi network at 1 Gbps speeds with Homeplug AV2. It's perfect for connecting smart TVs, streaming players and game consoles for HD video streaming and lag-free gaming.Plug, Pair and Play - Set up your powerline network and start enjoying fast, seamless wired/wireless connection in minutes. 

 The terms “AV1000” and “1000Mbps” are derived from applicable specifications and refer to the theoretical maximum physical-layer data transfer rate. Those terms are used on this product solely to indicate its compatibility with other “AV1000” or “1000Mbps” powerline devices. Actual data speeds vary and may be limited by the product’s Ethernet port and other network conditions such as data traffic, electrical noise, and wiring issues. For better performance, powerline devices should be deployed on the same electrical circuit and rated for the same HomePlug standard. A minimum of two powerline devices are required to establish a powerline connection. If you are uncertain about your network conditions, you should consult an IT professional to assist in selecting a networking product. 

 Maximum wireless transmission rates are the physical rates derived from IEEE Standard 802.11 specifications. Range and coverage specifications along with the number of connected devices were defined according to test results under normal usage conditions. 

 Actual wireless transmission rate, wireless coverage, and number of connected devices are not guaranteed, and will vary as a result of 

 1) environmental factors, including building materials, physical objects and obstacles, 

 2) network conditions, including local interference, volume and density of traffic, product location, network complexity, and network overhead and 

 3) client limitations, including rated performance, location, connection quality, and client condition. 

 
About power saving, actual power saved varies based on network conditions and environmental factors. 

Operating Temperature: 0°C~40°C (32°F ~104°F)
feature_bullets: Wi fi Powerline adapter provides up to 1000Mbps Ethernet over Power, up to dual band 750mbps(300mbps 2.4Ghz+433mbps 5GHz) Wi Fi ideal to be Ethernet extender who can easily go over the walls
Gigabit port, give you Full speed of Your internet
Power saving automatically reduces Power consumption by up to 85 percent
Plug & Play, No new wires and no configuration required
Data encryption by 128 bit AES to make the network safe and private
Compatible with all AV2000, AV1300, AV1200, Av1000, AV600, AV500, AV200 PowerPoint adapters
Industry leading Support: 2 Year Warranty and Free 24/7 technical Support
As network adapters Supporting Home Plug AV2, Easy to add Multiple adapters and works under 110 240V

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,471 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
